name: ANAC TOGO
about: The Agence Nationale de l'Aviation Civile du Togo (ANAC-TOGO) is the civil aviation authority of Togo, operating under the Minister of Civil Aviation. Established by law nÂ°2007-007 of 22 January 2007, ANAC-TOGO is responsible for implementing the state's civil aviation policy, negotiating international agreements, and developing technical regulations in line with ICAO standards. The agency oversees all aeronautical and airport activities, ensures compliance with national and international safety and security regulations, and manages traffic rights from air agreements. ANAC-TOGO also conducts audits, inspections, and staff training to maintain high safety standards and supports the implementation of the National Aviation Safety Program. With a strong commitment to international cooperation and aviation safety, ANAC-TOGO plays a pivotal role in regulating and supervising civil aviation in Togo, ensuring a safe and efficient aviation industry.
